title: Determine the Outcomes
text: To determine the probability of an event occurring, we want to first determine what the possible outcomes that represent the space are.

title: Determining A OR B
text: What is the list of outcomes that exist in A OR B? Effectively, which numbers between 1 and 19 inclusive are at least one of even OR greater than 13?

title: Definition of Probability
text: The probability of any outcome in the sample space occuring is the long-term relative frequency of that oucome. Effectively, to find the probability of an event, P(event), we need to find the size of that event (how many outcomes are in it) and divide that by the size of the sample space (how many outcomes are in it).

title: Size of A OR B
text: What is the size of A OR B? Effectively, how many numbers are from one to 19 are even OR greater than 13?

title: Size of Sample Space
text: What is the size of the sample space? Effectively, how many total whole numbers are there between 1 and 19 inclusive?

title: Determining P(A OR B)
text: What is P(A OR B), or what is the size of A OR B divided by the size of the sample size?
